DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the amount of time (in minutes) required to ablate a lesion, using microwave ablation.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A type of treatment in which body tissue is exposed to high temperatures to damage and kill cancer cells or to make cancer cells more sensitive to the effects of radiation and certain anticancer drugs._Removal of a part, pathway, or function by surgery, chemical destruction, electrocautery, or radiofrequency. (Taber's)_The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A type of treatment in which body tissue is exposed to high temperatures to damage and kill cancer cells or to make cancer cells more sensitive to the effects of radiation and certain anticancer drugs.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure in which microwave irradiation is used for the purpose of heating and destroying the surrounding tissue.

Property.preferredDefinition: Removal of a part, pathway, or function by surgery, chemical destruction, electrocautery, or radiofrequency. (Taber's):The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: Removal, separation, detachment, extirpation, or eradication of a body part, pathway, or function by surgery, chemical destruction, morbid process, or noxious substance.
The period of time during which something continues.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
